00228 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_SET_BIT
00229 #include <l4/util/atomic.h>
00230 L4_INLINE void
00231 l4util_set_bit(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00232 {
00233   l4_umword_t oldval, newval;
00234 
00235   dest += b / (sizeof(*dest) * 8); /* advance dest to the proper element */
00236   b    &= sizeof(*dest) * 8 - 1;   /* modulo; cut off all upper bits */
00237 
00238   do
00239     {
00240       oldval = *dest;
00241       newval = oldval | (1 << b);
00242     }
00243   while (!l4util_cmpxchg(dest, oldval, newval));
00244 }
00245 #endif
00246 
00247 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_CLEAR_BIT
00248 #include <l4/util/atomic.h>
00249 L4_INLINE void
00250 l4util_clear_bit(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00251 {
00252   l4_umword_t oldval, newval;
00253 
00254   dest += b / (sizeof(*dest) * 8);
00255   b    &= sizeof(*dest) * 8 - 1;
00256 
00257   do
00258     {
00259       oldval = *dest;
00260       newval = oldval & ~(1 << b);
00261     }
00262   while (!l4util_cmpxchg(dest, oldval, newval));
00263 }
00264 #endif
00265 
00266 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_TEST_BIT
00267 L4_INLINE int
00268 l4util_test_bit(int b, const volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00269 {
00270   dest += b / (sizeof(*dest) * 8);
00271   b    &= sizeof(*dest) * 8 - 1;
00272 
00273   return (*dest >> b) & 1;
00274 }
00275 #endif
00276 
00277 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_TEST_BIT32
00278 L4_INLINE int
00279 l4util_test_bit32(int b, const volatile l4_uint32_t * dest)
00280 {
00281   dest += b / (sizeof(*dest) * 8);
00282   b    &= sizeof(*dest) * 8 - 1;
00283 
00284   return (*dest >> b) & 1;
00285 }
00286 #endif
00287 
00288 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_TEST_AND_SET
00289 #include <l4/util/atomic.h>
00290 L4_INLINE int
00291 l4util_bts(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00292 {
00293   l4_umword_t oldval, newval;
00294 
00295   dest += b / (sizeof(*dest) * 8);
00296   b    &= sizeof(*dest) * 8 - 1;
00297 
00298   do
00299     {
00300       oldval = *dest;
00301       newval = oldval | (1 << b);
00302     }
00303   while (!l4util_cmpxchg(dest, oldval, newval));
00304 
00305   /* Return old bit */
00306   return (oldval >> b) & 1;
00307 }
00308 #endif
00309 
00310 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_TEST_AND_RESET
00311 #include <l4/util/atomic.h>
00312 L4_INLINE int
00313 l4util_btr(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00314 {
00315   l4_umword_t oldval, newval;
00316 
00317   dest += b / (sizeof(*dest) * 8);
00318   b    &= sizeof(*dest) * 8 - 1;
00319 
00320   do
00321     {
00322       oldval = *dest;
00323       newval = oldval & ~(1 << b);
00324     }
00325   while (!l4util_cmpxchg(dest, oldval, newval));
00326 
00327   /* Return old bit */
00328   return (oldval >> b) & 1;
00329 }
00330 #endif
00331 
00332 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_SCAN_REVERSE
00333 L4_INLINE int
00334 l4util_bsr(l4_umword_t word)
00335 {
00336   int i;
00337 
00338   if (!word)
00339     return -1;
00340 
00341   for (i = 8 * sizeof(word) - 1; i >= 0; i--)
00342     if ((1 << i) & word)
00343       return i;
00344 
00345   return -1;
00346 }
00347 #endif
00348 
00349 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_SCAN_FORWARD
00350 L4_INLINE int
00351 l4util_bsf(l4_umword_t word)
00352 {
00353   unsigned int i;
00354 
00355   if (!word)
00356     return -1;
00357 
00358   for (i = 0; i < sizeof(word) * 8; i++)
00359     if ((1 << i) & word)
00360       return i;
00361 
00362   return -1;
00363 }
00364 #endif
00365 
00366 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_FIND_FIRST_ZERO_BIT
00367 L4_INLINE int
00368 l4util_find_first_zero_bit(const void * dest, l4_size_t size)
00369 {
00370   l4_size_t i, j;
00371   unsigned long *v = (unsigned long*)dest;
00372 
00373   if (!size)
00374     return 0;
00375 
00376   size = (size + 31) & ~0x1f; /* Grmbl: adapt to x86 implementation... */
00377 
00378   for (i = j = 0; i < size; i++, j++)
00379     {
00380       if (j >= sizeof(*v) * 8)
00381   {
00382     j = 0;
00383     v++;
00384   }
00385       if (!((1 << j) & *v))
00386   return i;
00387     }
00388   return size + 1;
00389 }
00390 #endif
00391 
00392 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_COMPLEMENT_BIT
00393 L4_INLINE void
00394 l4util_complement_bit(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00395 {
00396   dest += b / (sizeof(*dest) * 8);
00397   b    &= sizeof(*dest) * 8 - 1;
00398 
00399   *dest ^= 1UL << b;
00400 }
00401 #endif
00402 
00403 /*
00404  * Adapted from:
00405  * http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_of_two#Algorithm_to_find_the_next-highest_power_of_two
00406  */
00407 L4_INLINE int
00408 l4util_next_power2(unsigned long val)
00409 {
00410   unsigned i;
00411 
00412   if (val == 0)
00413     return 1;
00414 
00415   val--;
00416   for (i=1; i < sizeof(unsigned long)*8; i<<=1)
00417     val = val | val >> i;
00418 
00419   return val+1;
00420 }
00421 
00422 
00423 /* Non-implemented version, catch with a linker warning */
00424 
00425 extern int __this_l4util_bitops_function_is_not_implemented_for_this_arch__sorry(void);
00426 
00427 #ifndef __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_CLEAR_BIT32
00428 L4_INLINE void
00429 l4util_clear_bit32(int b, volatile l4_uint32_t * dest)
00430 { (void)b; (void)dest; __this_l4util_bitops_function_is_not_implemented_for_this_arch__sorry(); }
00431 #endif

00434 L4_INLINE int
00435 l4util_btc(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00436 { (void)b; (void)dest; __this_l4util_bitops_function_is_not_implemented_for_this_arch__sorry(); return 0; }
00437 #endif

00439 #ifndef  __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_FIND_FIRST_SET_BIT
00440 L4_INLINE int
00441 l4util_find_first_set_bit(const void * dest, l4_size_t size)
00442 { (void)dest; (void)size; __this_l4util_bitops_function_is_not_implemented_for_this_arch__sorry(); return 0; }
